title: How to Clean a Keurig Water Reservoir

steps.title: Turn off the Keurig.
steps.content: Turn off the Keurig. Before you begin cleaning, make sure your Keurig is shut off and unplugged. [1] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. You’ll be using a lot of water in and around the unit, so you’ll want to safeguard the electrical components. If there’s a K-cup pod in the brewing chamber, take it out and dispose of it. [2] X Research source You can turn off your Keurig by flipping the on/off switch on the back of older models, or pressing and holding the power button on newer touch-screen models. [3] X Research source Wait until the display and power light are completely off before proceeding.

steps.title: Remove and empty the water reservoir.
steps.content: Remove and empty the water reservoir. [4] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Lift the reservoir tank straight off of its base, then pry off the lid and set it aside. Dump the old water out into the sink. Shake out as much excess moisture as you can. [5] X Research source You should get in the habit of changing the water in your Keurig’s reservoir daily, even when it’s between cleanings.

steps.title: Wipe the base clean with a damp cloth.
steps.content: Wipe the base clean with a damp cloth. [6] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Once you’ve detached the reservoir itself, quickly spot-clean the area of the unit where it rests. There may be hard water stains or coffee grounds built up on the base. These will get worse with time if left untreated. [7] X Research source While you’re at look, look for other parts of the machine that could use a wipe down, like the spout, mug tray or the area around the brewing chamber. [8] X Research source You can clean most of the exterior of the Keurig by simply wiping it down with warm water.

steps.title: Scrub the inside of the reservoir with warm, soapy water.
steps.content: Scrub the inside of the reservoir with warm, soapy water. Add a small amount of a mild liquid detergent to a sink full of warm water and stir it by hand. Submerge the reservoir in the soap solution and gently go over the interior with a sponge or clean cloth. Concentrate on the small port and mesh screen at the bottom of the reservoir where the buildup is likely to be heaviest. [9] X Research source For especially heavy stains or buildup, allow the reservoir to soak in the soap solution for 10-15 minutes before scrubbing. Don’t forget to go over the underside of the lid as well.

steps.title: Rinse the water reservoir thoroughly.
steps.content: Rinse the water reservoir thoroughly. Run fresh, hot water over the reservoir inside and out. Direct the stream over the port and screen for several seconds to make sure they’re sufficiently clear. Completely drain the reservoir of water when you’re done rinsing. [10] X Research source Be sure to rinse off any lingering traces of soap, or it could create a film on the plastic surface and affect the flavor of the coffee.

steps.title: Dry the reservoir with a clean, soft towel.
steps.content: Dry the reservoir with a clean, soft towel. A microfiber towel or absorbent chamois will provide the best results. You can also set the reservoir upside and leave it to air dry completely for a few hours. Once it’s dry, return the reservoir to its base, replace the lid and enjoy your next cup of coffee! [11] X Research source Be sure to leave the lid off of the reservoir while it’s air drying to prevent moisture from becoming trapped inside. Drying the reservoir with a paper towel or ordinary cloth could leave behind small fibers that can then find their way into your coffee.

steps.title: Clear out the water reservoir.
steps.content: Clear out the water reservoir. [12] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. If you use your Keurig very frequently and it hasn’t been cleaned in a long time, it may be in need of a total descaling. Start by pouring any remaining water out of the reservoir and returning it to the base empty. From here, you’ll be using the reservoir to disperse a special homemade cleaning solution through the machine. [13] X Research source ”Scale” refers to the natural mineral deposits from water that accumulate on surfaces over time. [14] X Research source If you decide to descale your Keurig, be sure to clean the water reservoir separately once you’re finished.

steps.title: Fill the reservoir with equal parts water and distilled white vinegar.
steps.content: Fill the reservoir with equal parts water and distilled white vinegar. [15] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Ordinary white vinegar can be used to safely descale your Keurig without the need for harsh chemicals. Run a few ounces of cool water in with the vinegar to dilute it. Fill the reservoir about two thirds of the way full. [16] X Research source Vinegar is an excellent natural cleaning agent. It’s mild, non-toxic and rinses away easily, leaving your coffee maker clean and sanitized. [17] X Research source When the brew cycle is activated, the vinegar mixture will be pulled through the water line and spout of the machine, eliminating buildup from the inside.

steps.title: Run a few brew cycles with the hot vinegar solution.
steps.content: Run a few brew cycles with the hot vinegar solution. [18] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. The acidity of the vinegar will help dissolve calcium deposits and hard water stains inside the machine. Use a large mug or another container to catch the hot contents as it emerges from the spout. Continue cycling the vinegar solution until nothing is left in the reservoir. [19] X Research source Do not place a K-cup in the brewing chamber. You’re just trying to flush the interior of the machine with the vinegar solution. [20] X Research source Run the Keurig on the largest cup setting to keep the maximum amount of water flowing through the machine. [21] X Research source Dispose of the used vinegar solution after each cycle.

steps.title: Spot clean other areas as needed.
steps.content: Spot clean other areas as needed. [22] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Some parts of the Keurig, such as the spout and brewing chamber, may be accessible to clean by hand. If there’s any mineral buildup remaining in these areas, you can scrub them with an unused toothbrush or the corner of a sponge. [23] X Research source Detail small holes and crevices, such as the grooves around the K-cup compartment, with a toothpick or paperclip. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Perform repeated brew cycles with only water.
steps.content: Perform repeated brew cycles with only water. [25] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Empty the reservoir and fill it back up with fresh or distilled water. Run the two or three more cycles to ensure that all the vinegar has been rinsed out. Keep running the Keurig until the water is completely clean and odorless. [26] X Research source You may need to drain and refill the reservoir a couple of times before the lingering notes of vinegar are fully dissipated. [27] X Research source If your Keurig is especially dirty, it may be a good idea to let the vinegar solution sit in the machine for 20-30 minutes before rinsing it out.
